Welcome to REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async main.root()¶

The root function returns a JSON object with the message &quot;Hello World&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary, which is converted to json

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A dictionary of the objects that are needed by the routes

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.block(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactBlackList, db: Session)¶

The block function is used to block a contact.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • body – ContactBlackList: Pass the json object to the block function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

async src.repository.contacts.create(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • body – ContactModel: Create a new contact object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(user: User, email, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in a user and an email address, and returns the contact associated with that email address.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • email – Filter the contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • contact_id – int: Filter the query by contact_id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_person(user: User, person: Person, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_person function returns a list of contacts for the given user and person.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • person – Person: Filter the contact list by person

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of all contacts that match the person

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_phone(user: User, phone, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_phone function returns a contact object from the database based on the user’s id and phone number.

Parameters:

  • user – Check if the user is logged in

  • phone – Filter the contact by phone number

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object if the user_id and phone number match a record in the database

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

All contacts for a given user

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_email(user: User, email, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_by_email function returns a list of contacts that match the email provided.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • email – Filter the contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of all contacts that match the email address

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_hb(user: User, contacts_id_list, limit, offset, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_hb function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • contacts_id_list – Get the contacts with the ids in that list

  • limit – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – Skip the first n results

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_hb_id_list(user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_hb_id_list function returns a list of contact IDs for contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts’ ids,

async src.repository.contacts.remove(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(user: User, data: str, db: Session)¶

The search_contacts function searches for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • data – str: Pass in the search query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

async src.repository.contacts.update(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The update function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to update

  • body – ContactModel: Get the new values for the contact

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API repository Persons¶

async src.repository.persons.create(body: PersonModel, db: Session, user: User)¶
The create function creates a new person in the database.

It takes in a body of type PersonModel, which is validated by Pydantic. The function also takes in a db Session and user object from FastAPI’s dependency injection system.

Parameters:

  • body – PersonModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

The newly created person object

async src.repository.persons.get_person_by_first_name(first_name, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_person_by_first_name function returns a person by first name

Parameters:

  • first_name – Filter the results of the query

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A list of all the persons with a given first name

async src.repository.persons.get_person_by_id(person_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_person_by_id function returns a person object from the database.

Parameters:

  • person_id – int: Specify the id of the person to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

The person object with the given id and user

async src.repository.persons.get_person_by_last_name(last_name, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_person_by_last_name function returns a person by last name

Parameters:

  • last_name – Filter the results by last name

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A list of all the persons with a given last name

async src.repository.persons.get_person_by_name(first_name, last_name, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_person_by_name function returns a person object from the database by a first name and last name.

Parameters:

  • first_name – Filter the query to find a person with that first name

  • last_name – Filter the results of the query by last name

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A person object with the given first name and last name

async src.repository.persons.get_persons(db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_persons function returns a list of all persons in the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A list of person objects

async src.repository.persons.remove(person_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

The remove function removes a person from the database.

Parameters:

  • person_id – int: Specify the id of the person to be removed

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

The person object that was deleted

async src.repository.persons.update(person_id: int, body: PersonModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

The update function updates a person in the database.

Parameters:

  • person_id – int: Specify the id of the person to update

  • body – PersonModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

An updated person object

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The new user

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object with the email address that was passed in

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

An instance of user

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Pass in the token that is returned from the api

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

Nothing

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.block_contact(body: ContactBlackList, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The block_contact function is used to block a contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBlackList: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

None

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days. The function takes an optional limit and offset parameter to control pagination.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an id of the contact and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user. The function takes in an optional limit and offset query parameters to paginate through the results.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), find: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The search_contact function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a string as an argument and returns a list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • find – str: Search for a contact

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input string

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, which is then used to update the contact. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The updated contact object

REST API routes Persons¶

async src.routes.persons.create_person(body: PersonModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_person function creates a new person in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – PersonModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A person object

async src.routes.persons.delete_person(person_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_person function deletes a person from the database.

The function takes in an integer ID of the person to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that person. If no such user exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • person_id – int: Get the person id from the path

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user information

Returns:

A person object

async src.routes.persons.get_person(person_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_person function returns a person by id.

If the person does not exist, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • person_id – int: Specify the path parameter

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A person by id

async src.routes.persons.get_persons(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_persons function returns a list of persons.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of person objects

async src.routes.persons.update_person(body: PersonModel, person_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_person function updates a person in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated person. If no person is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – PersonModel: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • person_id – int: Get the person id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The updated person

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the user object from the database

Returns:

The current user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. It also takes in a User object and Session object as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is uploaded by the user

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that it has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A json response with the access token and refresh token

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying that they are already confirmed. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the data from the request body to our function

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the access token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created by encoding the data with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, and adding an iat (issued at) timestamp and exp (expiration) timestamp to it.

Parameters:

data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s information, such as their username and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded token that contains the data passed to it as well as a timestamp of when the token was created and an expiration date

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user associated with the refresh token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address of the user who is currently logged in

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

password – str: Specify the password that will be hashed

Returns:

A string that is a hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – Check if the password entered by the user matches with what is stored in the database

  • hashed_password – Check the password that is being passed in against the hashed password stored in the database

Returns:

True if the plain_password is correct, and false otherwise

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three parameters: -email: EmailStr, the user’s email address that they entered when signing up for an account. -username: str, the username of the user who is trying to sign up for an account. This will be used in conjunction with host (see below) and token_verification (see below) as part of a URL that will be sent via email to verify their identity and allow them access into our system.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Create the link to the frontend

Returns:

A coroutine object

REST API service Upload Avatar¶

class src.services.upload_avatar.UploadService¶

Bases: object

static create_avatar_name(email: str, prefix: str)¶

The create_avatar_name function takes an email address and a prefix, and returns a string that is the name of the avatar image. The name is a hash of the email address with 12 characters from it.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user

  • prefix – str: Specify the prefix of the avatar name

Returns:

A string

static get_avatar_url(public_id, version)¶
The get_avatar_url function takes in a public_id and version number,

then returns the URL of the avatar image.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Specify the image to be used

  • version – Create a unique url for each image

Returns:

A url for the avatar image

static upload(file, public_id)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. It then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. The function returns a dictionary containing information about the uploaded image.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – Specify the name of the file that will be uploaded to cloudinary

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys
